org.seedstack.i18n

Interface LocalizationService


  • @Service
public interface LocalizationService
    This service provides common localization features according to a specified locale.
    Author:
    adrien.lauer@mpsa.com, yves.dautremay@mpsa.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        String localize(String locale,
                String key)
        Return a localized string based on the specified locale and key. If the translation is not found in the given locale, the method reach parent locales (eg. "fr-BE" then "fr"). If no translation is found "[" + key + "]" is returned.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        key - The i18n key to translate.
        Returns:
        The translation result.

      • localize

        String localize(String locale,
                String key,
                Object... args)
        Return a localized string based on the specified locale and key. The pattern is formatted according to the given arguments
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        key - The i18n key to translate.
        args - The arguments used for message formatting.
        Returns:
        The translation result.
        See Also:
        localize(String, String)

      • formatDate

        String formatDate(String locale,
                  Date date,
                  String skeleton)
        Format a date using the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        date - The date to format.
        skeleton - The pattern elements that will be included in the formatted string.
        Returns:
        The formatted date as a string.

      • formatDate

        String formatDate(String locale,
                  Date date,
                  String skeleton,
                  String timezone)
        Format a date using the specified locale and the specified timezone.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        date - The date to format.
        skeleton - The pattern elements that will be included in the formatted string.
        timezone - The timezone identifier.
        Returns:
        The formatted date as a string.

      • parseDate

        Date parseDate(String locale,
               String value,
               String skeleton)
        throws ParseException
        Parse a date using the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        value - The string to parse.
        skeleton - The pattern elements used to parse the string.
        Returns:
        The parsed date object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the given string cannot be parsed into a Date

      • parseDate

        Date parseDate(String locale,
               String value,
               String skeleton,
               String timezone)
        throws ParseException
        Parse a date using the specified locale and the specified timezone.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        value - The string to parse.
        skeleton - The pattern elements used to parse the string.
        timezone - The timezone identifier.
        Returns:
        The parsed date object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the given string cannot be parsed into a Date

      • formatCurrencyAmount

        String formatCurrencyAmount(String locale,
                            Number amount)
        Format the specified amount in the locale currency.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        amount - The amount to format.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.

      • formatCurrencyAmount

        String formatCurrencyAmount(String locale,
                            Number amount,
                            String currency)
        Format the specified amount in the specified locale and currency.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        amount - The amount to format.
        currency - The currency identifier as a 3-letter ISO4217 code.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.

      • parseCurrencyAmount

        Number parseCurrencyAmount(String locale,
                           String value)
                    throws ParseException
        Parse the specified amount in the locale default currency.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        value - The value to parse.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the given value cannot be parsed into an amount

      • parseCurrencyAmount

        Number parseCurrencyAmount(String locale,
                           String value,
                           String currency)
                    throws ParseException
        Parse the specified amount in the specified locale and currency.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale identifier.
        value - The value to parse.
        currency - The currency identifier.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the given value cannot be parsed into an amount

        String formatNumber(String locale,
                    Number number)
        Format a number according to the specified locale.
        Parameters:

        number - The number to format.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.

                   String value)
            throws ParseException
        Parse a number according to the specified locale.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
